title: European elections: A look back at a French campaign dominated by domestic issues
summary: The president's camp, which had previously made Europe one of its flagship issues, failed to assert its positions. Several of its rivals, starting with the lead far-right candidate, attempted to turn the vote into an 'anti-Macron referendum.'

title: Israel frees four hostages in deadly Gaza raid
summary: The Israeli army carried out a rare operation to free four Hamas captives held since October 7, 2023, in the center of the enclave. The nearby Al-Aqsa hospital reported at least 94 Palestinian deaths.

title: French Open 2024: Swiatek wins third successive title
summary: The Polish tennis player won 6-2, 6-1 against Italy's Jasmine Paolini in Roland Garros on Saturday.

title: Christophe Deloire, secretary general of Reporters Without Borders, has died
summary: The face of the press freedom NGO passed away on Saturday at the age of 53 'as a result of fast-spreading cancer,' the organization announced.

title: Le Monde and Europe, a quintessentially French history
summary: Throughout its 80-year history, Le Monde has proclaimed its European convictions, but without making Europe the beating heart of its editorial line.

title: What are the five best traditional baguettes in the Paris region?
summary: These addresses follow the traditional French baguette recipe to a T. With honeycombed crumb, crisp crust and a subtle, sourdough taste, it's a treat from morning to night.

title: Macron welcomes Biden for state visit
summary: The state visit began with a ceremony at the Arc de Triomphe and a military parade along the Champs-Elysées. A state dinner is later organized at the Elysée Palace for Biden and his wife, Jill.

title: WWII veteran, 100, marries sweetheart, 96, in Normandy after D-Day events
summary: Harold Terens and his sweetheart Jeanne Swerlin said 'I do' in the Normandy town of Carentan-les-Marais at a ceremony attended by dozens of guests.

title: Should Europeans work more to halt economic decline?
summary: Europeans work far less than Americans. Governments across the continent are seeking to reverse this trend by inciting citizens to work more, even if it might not be the solution.

title: Zelensky thanks France for its support in front of sparse crowd at Assemblée Nationale
summary: Some MPs refused this delayed invitation from the Ukrainian president, just a few hours before the end of the European election campaign.

title: 2024 European elections: Who is running in France?
summary: France will vote on June 9 to elect 81 members of the European Parliament, as the 27 member states of the European Union renew the legislature's 720 seats.

title: Danish PM has 'minor whiplash' from assault, cancels day's engagements
summary: A man arrested for hitting Mette Frederiksen in a Copenhagen square on Saturday will appear before a judge Saturday.

title: PM Rishi Sunak has made one gaffe after another before the UK elections
summary: The blunder-prone conservative prime minister apologized, on Friday, for cutting short his attendance at the commemorations of the 80th anniversary of the Normandy landings.

title: Protesters against 'climaticidal' projects converge at highway in southern France
summary: Several thousand people are expected to attend the demonstrations scheduled for June 7-9, in the Tarn region of southwest France, which have been banned by the authorities. A series of incidents have occurred in the past few weeks.

title: French Open 2024: AI-powered tools help filter online hate targeting athletes
summary: The French company Bodyguard, which specializes in social media moderation, is in charge of protecting the tournament accounts and those of over 20 players.

title: Spain's government seeks to push through a reduction in weekly working hours
summary: Madrid is pushing the country's unions and employers to negotiate a move to a 37.5-hour working week by 2025, down from the current 40 hours.

title: Sexuality: Lesbians, the champions of pleasure
summary: Statistics show that homosexual women have a more fulfilling erotic life. If they are better at making love, let us be humble and listen to what they have to say, writes Le Monde's sex columnist Maïa Mazaurette.

title: Rahul Gandhi nominated as leader of India's opposition
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's chief rival defied analysts' expectations and exit polls to help his Congress party nearly double its parliamentary numbers.

title: Russian interference: European media caught in a bind
summary: The Kremlin takes advantage of media coverage of its disinformation efforts in Europe to further strengthen them.

title: Aid being delivered to Gaza from US pier once again
summary: The pier has been plagued by problems since its inception. It broke apart due to high winds and strong waves last month.

title: Why is Jordan Bardella so popular among young French voters?
summary: Whether on TikTok or at a rally, Jordan Bardella, the Rassemblement National's lead candidate in the European elections, is garnering support among certain sectors of France's high school, university, and young working demographics.

title: Protectionist escalation: 'Europe could be engulfed in the economic rivalry between China and the US'
summary: New US tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles mark a turning point in the fragmentation of trade, says economist Agathe Demarais in an interview with Le Monde.

title: Colombia pummels US 5-1 in Copa America warmup
summary: It is Team USA's heaviest loss under the leadership of coach Gregg Berhalter.

title: EU elections: Final poll shows race still uncertain in France
summary: The far-right RN has a stable lead, while President Macron's ruling coalition is neck-and-neck with the Socialists for second place, and the radical left is rising, according to an IPSOS poll for Le Monde conducted during the last two days of the campaign.

title: Israeli universities brace for growing threat of boycotts
summary: Western higher education institutions are beginning to suspend relations with their counterparts in Israel, on the grounds that they contribute to the system of occupation and colonization of Palestine.

title: Ruthless Iga Swiatek triumphs at French Open
summary: The Polish tennis star showed no mercy on Saturday, beating surprise Italian contender Jasmine Paolini 6-2, 6-1. At 23, this is now her third Roland Garros win in a row, the fourth of her career.

title: Europeans vote in crucial elections for EU's future
summary: The shape of the future majority and the place of the far right in the governance of the Union will depend on the results of the vote that ends on Sunday, at a time when security, economic and climate challenges are pressing.

title: Europeans are worried about Trump's return to the White House
summary: Whoever the president may be, it won't make much of a difference on the economic front. In terms of security, however, the EU 27 are concerned about Trump's criticism of NATO and the US's growing disinterest in the EU.

title: Assault that left Danish PM 'shaken' likely not 'politically motivated'
summary: A 39-year-old Polish man, apprehended after hitting Mette Frederiksen on Friday evening on a Copenhagen square, was remanded in custody until June 20.

title: Meloni has won over Biden, now she hopes for Trump's return
summary: The Italian prime minister cultivates a long-standing closeness with American conservative circles, and hopes to capitalize on this politically if the former Republican president returns to the White House.

title: European election results: Far right claims large lead in France
summary: The Rassemblement National, led by Marine Le Pen's lieutenant Jordan Bardella, dominated the election in France, winning 31.5% of the votes, according to initial estimates.

title: EU election results: The main takeaways
summary: More than 360 million people were eligible to vote in 27 countries, in the four-day election that will shape the European Union's direction over the next five years.

title: 2024 European elections results: Explore our map and view the make-up of the future Parliament
summary: Our map representing the 720 seats in the European Parliament will update as estimates and results come in.

title: How the far right envisions Europe
summary: Despite a common nationalist base, the Europe's various far-right groups are now investing their energies into Europe and the European Union again, for strategic and, in some cases, ideological reasons.

title: Israel war cabinet minister Gantz quits government
summary: Gantz said last month he would resign from the war cabinet if Netanyahu did not approve a post-war plan for Gaza by June 8.

title: Carlos Alcaraz beats Alexander Zverev to win first French Open title
summary: The 21-year-old Spanish player battled cramps to recover from 2-1 down in sets and win a gripping tennis competition after four hours and 19 minutes.

title: Experts squabble over Géricault exhibition at the Musée de la Vie romantique
summary: The attribution of certain unpublished works, displayed at the Paris exhibition 'Géricault's Horses,' is hotly contested.

title: Macron calls early elections after historic far-right gains in European vote
summary: The Rassemblement National, led by Marine Le Pen's lieutenant Jordan Bardella, dominated the election in France, winning 31.5% of the votes, according to initial estimates.

title: 2024 European elections: Far-right Rassemblement National achieves historic success
summary: The party led by Marine Le Pen's lieutenant Jordan Bardella was credited with over 30% of the vote, according to initial estimates on Sunday.
